feed.title: Mercercrest Bridge Club Blog
feed.subtitle: A blog for the Mercercrest Bridge Club, mostly for results postings.

entry.title: October 08, 2019 Results
entry.content:
Thanks for coming to tonight’s game.

Good luck to everyone playing in the District 19 GNTs this weekend in Canada!

Next week will be a club championship game.

Winners tonight were Jeff Ford and Aaron Mohrman. Flight B winners were Cornel Galer and Bogdan Vulcan.

Full results are available at https://mercerislandbridge.github.io/2019/191008E.htm

Common game results are available at http://thecommongame.com/NiteResults/20191008Rank.html
entry.summary: Thanks for coming to tonight’s game.

entry.title: October 01, 2019 Results
entry.content:
Thanks for coming to tonight’s game. Good luck to everyone playing in Seaside!

Tonight we say a fond farewell to Pete Cowles, at least for a while - who would ever think that the Caribbean was a better place to spend the winter than Seattle?

Our top three places tonight were separated by only one matchpoint so check your scores. :) First was Bryan Delfs and Jen Chalfan, second were the Whites and third were Kim Eng and Chris Moore.

Full results are available at https://mercerislandbridge.github.io/2019/191001E.htm

Common game results are available at http://thecommongame.com/NiteResults/20191001Rank.html
entry.summary: Thanks for coming to tonight’s game. Good luck to everyone playing in Seaside!

entry.title: September 24, 2019 Results
entry.content:
Thanks for coming to tonight’s game.

Winners tonight were Jeff Ford and Kim Eng. Second overall and first in Flight B were Brian Zaugg and Bogdan Vulcan. Flight C winners were Brad Rind and John Uchida.

Good luck to everyone playing in Seaside next week, and we look forward to seeing the rest of you here!

Full results are available at https://mercerislandbridge.github.io/2019/190924E.htm

Common game results are available at http://thecommongame.com/NiteResults/20190924Rank.html
entry.summary: Thanks for coming to tonight’s game.

entry.title: September 17, 2019 Results
entry.content:
Thanks for coming to tonight’s game.

Good luck to everyone in the Sectional this weekend! And come back on Tuesday for an International Fund game that pays extra masterpoints.

Winners tonight were Jeff Ford and Kim Eng. Winning B were John McCaslin and Grant Davis. Winning C were Brad Rind and John Uchida.

Full results are available at https://mercerislandbridge.github.io/2019/190917E.htm

Common game results are available at http://thecommongame.com/NiteResults/20190917Rank.html
entry.summary: Thanks for coming to tonight’s game.

entry.title: August 13, 2019 Results
entry.content:
Thanks for coming to tonight’s game. First N/S were Jeff Ford and David Taylor, followed by Bill and Greg Herman, with Kevin Cline and David Hankins in third. First E/W were Bogdan Vulcan and Cornel Galer, followed by Joel Fuhrman and David Walker in second and Kim Eng and Eric Sieg in third. Congrat to all the winners!

REMINDER: There is no game next week, August 20th, due to the Lynwood Regional. We’ll resume August 27th. Good luck to everyone playing!

«Insert announcements»

«Insert winners»

Full results are available at https://mercerislandbridge.github.io/2019/190813E.htm

Common game results are available at http://thecommongame.com/NiteResults/20190813Rank.html

entry.title: August 06, 2019 Results
entry.content:

We will be closed in 2 weeks for Lynnwood

Congrats to Ray and Jeff for winning tonights game.

The Review of the hands can be found at https://drive.google.com/file/d/17cTH8w-xKDc98zLuGKt3OCIdcjpvVOUo/view

entry.title: July 30, 2019 Results
entry.content:
Thanks for coming to tonight’s game. We apologize for the mixup with the predealt hands, and appreciate the patience of people who played last week.

Our winners tonight were Jeff Ford and Haig Tchamitch in Flight A, and Brad Rind and Terry Jacobson in Flights B and C.

Full results are available at https://mercerislandbridge.github.io/2019/190730E.htm
entry.summary: Thanks for coming to tonight’s game. We apologize for the mixup with the predealt hands, and appreciate the patience of people who played last week.
